questions.answer: False (The drawing-canvas is the top layer responsible for displaying the user's drawn lines and shapes; the video-canvas is used for the background)

questions.question: After performing the undo gesture (closed fist), the user is immediately allowed to begin drawing again.
questions.answer: False (After an undo, the system imposes a 1-second cooldown period)

questions.question: When the user selects the "Eraser" tool, the brushColor variable is changed to #FFFFFF (white).
questions.answer: False (When erasing, the system sets the drawingCtx.globalComposite Operation to destination-out)

You win the game right away if you score 1 point.

The opponent's move is always ROCK because it's the easiest for the computer to choose.

The process of drawing hand landmarks onto the canvas is an example of Data Visualization, which helps developers debug the model's performance in real-time.
The Feature Engineering in this code involves transforming the raw 3D coordinates (landmarks) into a low-dimensional, 5-element boolean array.
Using the Camera object and hands.send() establishes a Synchronous Data Pipeline, forcing the entire program to pause until the ML model returns results.
The gesture logic is built on Pose Estimation output, as it uses the relative position of joints (e.g., tip vs. knuckle) rather than just the absolute position of the hand.
The Handedness (Left or Right) label provided by the MediaPipe model is only used to correctly calculate the thumb's extended state.

questions.answer: A pinch (index finger and thumb close together)

questions.question: SafeDrive allows you to detect multiple drowsy events.
SafeDrive detects drowsy events including yawns, nodding, and prolonged eye closure.
MediaPipe has built-in yawn and prolonged eye closure detection.
If absolute yaw or yaw $is>8$ while pitch $>=-8$, the webapp will not label it as nodding.
What post-processing technique allows you to reduce output jitter and noise by creating enter and exit gates on threshold outputs.
